required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OPIOID Study - Pain With Osmotic Dilators
clinical_study.official_title: OPIOID Study: Opioid Use and Pain After Insertion of Osmotic Dilators

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of pain levels and pain medications utilized following insertion of two different types of osmotic dilators.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial to assess and compare pain levels and pain medication needs following placement of Laminaria versus Dilapan-S for cervical preparation prior to second-trimester dilation and evacuation (D&E) procedures. Pain levels and medication usage will also be assessed following the D&E procedure itself, up to 7 days after the procedure.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomly assigned to receive one of two existing dilator times, with the remainder of care and study procedures being identical.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will not know what type of dilator they have been assigned, however the medical care team (including investigators) will be aware.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum pain above baseline following Laminaria versus Dilapan-S placement
primary_outcome.description: Timed surveys measuring pain on Numeric Rating Scale (0-10), administered approximately 24 hours after dilator placement

primary_outcome.measure: Time of maximum pain above baseline following Laminaria versus Dilapan-S placement
primary_outcome.description: Timing of maximum Numeric Rating Scale (0-10) pain difference among measurements approximately 24 hours after dilator placement

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain medication use after Laminaria versus Dilapan-S placement
secondary_outcome.description: Timed surveys of pain medication usage at 2 hours, 4 hours, 8 hours, and approximately 24 hours after dilator placement

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum pain increase over baseline following D&E procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Timed surveys measuring pain on Numeric Rating Scale (0-10), administered at 1 hour, 4 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, and 1 week after D&E procedure
Timed surveys of pain medication usage, administered at 4 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, and 1 week after D&E procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- scheduled D&E for 15+0 to 23+6 wga
- ability to speak and read in English
- ownership of smartphone with internet access and data plan
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic pain, fibromyalgia, active pelvic infection, inability to take NSAIDS, current use of narcotics

facility.name: Albany Medical Center Obstetrics and Gynecology
